Event.0: Battle of Baekgang: Tang Chinese and Silla Korean forces defeat Korean Baekje forces and their Yamato Japanese allies on the Geum River in Korea; - no Japanese invasion of Korea for 900 years
Event.1: BC Greco-Persian Wars: Battle of Plataea, Persian forces led by Mardonius routed by Greek army under Pausanias; together with Greek success at Battle of Mycale halts Persian invasion of Greece
Event.2: BC Greco-Persian Wars: Battle of Mycale won by Greek forces over Persian naval troops on Ionian coast, double victory with that at Plataea ends Persian invasion
Event.3: Democratic politician Barack Obama became the first African American to be nominated for the presidency by either major party; he later defeated Republican John McCain to win the office.
Event.4: German kayaker Birgit Fischer wins gold in K-4 500m & silver in K-2 500m in Athens; first woman in any sport to win gold medals at 6 different Olympics, gold 24 years apart, and 1st person to win 2 or more medals in 5 different Games
Event.5: Louis Mountbatten, 1st Earl Mountbatten of Burma, was assassinated by the Provisional Irish Republican Army.
Event.6: The Earl Mountbatten of Burma, cousin of Queen Elizabeth II and last Viceroy of India, is killed along with three companions, two of them children by the IRA when his boat is blown up near Sligo, Ireland
Event.7: American sportscaster Al Michaels (21) weds Linda Stamaton
Event.8: The Beatles spend an evening with Elvis Presley
Event.9: Walt Disney's "Mary Poppins" directed by Robert Stevenson and starring Julie Andrews and Dick van Dyke premieres in Los Angeles
Event.10: Walt Disney's "Mary Poppins" directed by Robert Stevenson and starring Julie Andrews and Dick van Dyke premieres in Los Angeles
Event.11:
Tom Ford
American fashion designer
was born
Event.12: Socialite Gloria Vanderbilt (32) weds "12 Angry Men" director Sidney Lumet (32)
Event.13: 1st transmission of a TV programme from continental Europe shown on BBC
Event.14: German Ernst Heinrich Heinkel's He 178, a turbojet-powered aircraft, made the first jet flight.
Event.15: Journalist H. L. Mencken (49) weds author Sara Haardt (32) at St. Stephen’s Episcopal Church
Event.16: The Kellogg-Briand Pact was signed between France and the United States in a series of peacekeeping efforts after World War I.
Event.17: American politician Lyndon B. Johnson, who served as the 36th president of the United States (1963–69), was born.
Event.18:
Don Bradman
Australian cricketer
was born
Event.19:
Lyndon B. Johnson
president of United States
was born
Event.20:
Ed Gein
American serial killer
was born
Event.21:
Man Ray
American photographer and painter
was born
Event.22: Krakatoa volcano, west of Java in Indonesia, erupts with a force of 1,300 megatons and kills approximately 40,000 people
Event.23: Edwin Laurentine Drake struck oil while drilling in Titusville, Pennsylvania, becoming the first driller of a productive oil well in the United States.
Event.24: French National Assembly issues "Declaration of Rights of Man & Citizen"
Event.25: During the American Revolution, British forces under General William Howe defeated George Washington and the American Continental Army in the Battle of Long Island.
Event.26:
The death of Titian
Titian, the greatest Italian Renaissance painter of the Venetian school, who was once described as “the sun amidst small stars not only among the Italians but all the painters of the world,” died this day in 1576.
